name: NewYorker
text: In a talk delivered to a group of educators in 1963, James Baldwin insisted that a more honest reckoning with history was necessary. https://t.co/WIGjhANWzZ

name: NewYorker
text: "The mixture of rage and resignation I felt after watching was compounded by the suspicion that 'On the Record' may get lost in the shuffle," @dstfelix writes, about the new show on HBO Max. https://t.co/gS56KC5zx3

name: NewYorker
text:
Not all novels should be, or could be, as playful as this one, Dave Eggers writes, "but it wouldn’t hurt to have a few more that allow humans—characters, readers, authors even—to laugh."
https://t.co/nZcZM6XlxG

name: NewYorker
text:
Craig Atkinson’s 2016 documentary film “Do Not Resist” traces the transformation of U.S. police departments into forces that often look and act like our Army and Marines.
https://t.co/K7gMQrZirJ

name: NewYorker
text: On Friday, Mayor de Blasio answered questions about the N.Y.P.D. response to the protests on “The Brian Lehrer Show.” It was a 30-minute performance of defensiveness, denial, and bizarre false equivalence. https://t.co/YTiDnr6IJr

name: NewYorker
text: In the years after her mother and eight other members of the Emanuel A.M.E. Church were murdered by a white supremacist, Reverend Sharon Risher rose above her doubts in humanity to become an activist against gun violence. https://t.co/0PEn2iGZ2S

name: NewYorker
text:
It’s only at the end of @MeghaMaj’s brief, brave first novel that the reader becomes fully aware of how broad its judgments are, how fierce and absolute its condemnations.
https://t.co/lOmElYn694

name: NewYorker
text: Much of the writing in Samantha Harvey’s new memoir, about her year-long struggle with insomnia, mirrors the deranged logic of the sleep-starved brain. https://t.co/n3mywhqaQR

name: NewYorker
text: “I love the words,” one antiquarian bookseller said, of the specialized language used within the trade. “The way that they relate to humans—the head of the spine, the foot of the spine, the spine.” https://t.co/jjb90tjhiJ

name: NewYorker
text: Tune in to this week’s episode of #NewYorkerRadio for a conversation between @jelani9 and a former police chief who agrees that an institution rooted in racial repression cannot easily be reformed. Listen here. https://t.co/SSHgUnyuNX

name: NewYorker
text: At 88 years old, the regal Irish novelist Edna O’Brien is publishing new fiction—and recalling her early rise to fame. https://t.co/TKPaFbuVI5

name: NewYorker
text: A look at the world of Instagram practice accounts, where a motivated high-school violinist can have more followers than the first-prize cellist in the International Tchaikovsky Competition. https://t.co/ObMUanpken

name: NewYorker
text: In his documentary “And When I Die, I Won’t Stay Dead,” Billy Woodberry finds an original way to evoke Bob Kaufman’s remarkable life and work, even in the poet’s absence. https://t.co/HSowq2lxYj

name: NewYorker
text: Patrik Svensson has seen eels that appear to be dead but are not, and eels that really are dead—chopped up and frying in butter, even—but still move as though they were alive. The eel “eludes the usual measures of the world,” he writes. https://t.co/fkExlLuz7z

name: NewYorker
text: With relatively few exceptions, the armed forces have hewed to the rule that they should never be deployed against American citizens. But President Trump has shown himself willing to trash any institution that he can’t bend to his will. https://t.co/TxLEHYmzt5

name: NewYorker
text: “___ Me” (Rihanna hit): six letters. https://t.co/fFPGfzYiMu

name: NewYorker
text:
No one, perhaps, was more suited to exploit the idea of genius-as-enigma than Prince Rogers Nelson, who was born on this day in 1958.

name: NewYorker
text: From an oral history of Berlin techno to a 1962 novel about the Spanish Civil War, our contributors share what they’re reading this summer. https://t.co/l1uaRAdwWa

name: NewYorker
text: RT @erinoverbey: Sunday reading from @NewYorker archive: this week, we're highlighting a selection of pieces about racial injustice & police conduct in America—w/stories by @tnyCloseRead, @allysonvhobbs, @jelani9, @GoodMarable, and more. #NewYorkerArchive https://t.co/daVXegAV0w
